# Badge Templates

Copy and paste these badges into your README.md. Replace `YOUR_USERNAME` with your GitHub username.

## GitHub Actions Status Badges

### Comprehensive Test Suite
```markdown
![Tests](https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/two_particles_MD/actions/workflows/tests.yml/badge.svg)
```

### Simple Test Suite
```markdown
![Tests (Simple)](https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/two_particles_MD/actions/workflows/tests-simple.yml/badge.svg)
```

### Both Badges
```markdown
![Tests](https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/two_particles_MD/actions/workflows/tests.yml/badge.svg)
![Tests (Simple)](https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/two_particles_MD/actions/workflows/tests-simple.yml/badge.svg)
```

## Badge Preview

When properly configured, your badges will look like this:

- ✅ **Tests passing**: Green badge with "passing" text
- ❌ **Tests failing**: Red badge with "failing" text
- ⚠️ **Tests running**: Yellow badge with "running" text
- ⚪ **No runs yet**: Gray badge with "no status" text

## Shields.io Custom Badges

Create custom badges at [shields.io](https://shields.io):

```markdown
![Custom](https://img.shields.io/badge/YOUR_LABEL-YOUR_MESSAGE-COLOR)
```

**Colors:** brightgreen, green, yellowgreen, yellow, orange, red, blue, lightgrey, success, important, critical, informational, inactive

**Examples:**
```markdown
![Status](https://img.shields.io/badge/status-stable-brightgreen)
![Version](https://img.shields.io/badge/version-1.0.0-blue)
![Platform](https://img.shields.io/badge/platform-linux%20%7C%20windows%20%7C%20macos-lightgrey)
```
